item.title: Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.
item.description:
Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.

If the first step to recovery is admitting there's a problem, three First Nations around Kamsack, in east-central Saskatchewan, have reached that point. ​Leaders of the Federation of Saskatchewan Indian Nations and the Key, Cote and Keeseekoose First Nations sounded the alarm this week about a crisis in their communities.

item.title: Alcohol and Tobacco in French teenagers' favorite TV shows
item.description:
Alcohol and Tobacco in French teenagers' favorite TV shows

Boris Chapoton is a researcher in cancer prevention . In this article, he provides an overview of his work on media influence and substance use in young people, which led to him being awarded the EUSPR/ SPAN Early Career Researcher Prize at the recent EUSPR conference.

item.title: Arsenic was their poison - we have tobacco, guns and sugar | David Shariatmadari
item.description:
Arsenic was their poison - we have tobacco, guns and sugar | David Shariatmadari

In the spring and summer of 1871, Brighton was gripped by a series of mysterious poisonings. Chocolate creams from Maynard's, a local sweet shop, had made several people ill. A metallic taste in the mouth was the first sign that something was wrong, followed by a burning sensation in the throat, vomiting and muscle spasms. The symptoms quickly passed, however, and no one thought to take it any further.

item.title: Thinking to some purpose
item.description:
Thinking to some purpose

I spent a great day on Wednesday at the annual Alcohol Research UK conference. There was a huge amount of evidence on show, and discussion about the nature of evidence-based policy, how research can produce impact and shape policy. The discussion really boiled down to whether there could be a common language, and genuine communication between researchers and policymakers.

item.title: Is there something weird about our taste for apocalypse stories? - Frank Bures - Aeon Essays
item.description:
Is there something weird about our taste for apocalypse stories? - Frank Bures - Aeon Essays

One day in the early 1980s, I was flipping through the TV channels, when I stopped at a news report. The announcer was grey-haired. His tone was urgent. His pronouncement was dire: between the war in the Middle East, famine in Africa, AIDS in the cities, and communists in Afghanistan, it was clear that the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse were upon us.

item.title: I Got Drunk and Cheated Death in a Ceremonial Horse Race | VICE | United States
item.description:
I Got Drunk and Cheated Death in a Ceremonial Horse Race | VICE | United States

Watch our documentary about Guatemala's wild, wasted horse race coming soon on VICE. This article appeared in the March issue of VICE magazine. Click HERE to subscribe. Every year in Todos Santos Cuchumatán, Guatemala, the Mayan townspeople throw the local equivalent of a harvest festival.

item.title: The Kills - Doing It To Death (Official Video)
item.description:
The Kills - Doing It To Death (Official Video)

Doing It To Death (Official Video) Taken from "Ash & Ice" - the brand new album from The Kills, out June 3rd 2016.

item.title: Why are so many prisoners from ethnic minorities? I intend to find out | David Lammy
item.description:
Why are so many prisoners from ethnic minorities? I intend to find out | David Lammy

Where America leads, Britain usually follows. Art and culture, film and fashion, language and political ideas all have a habit of crossing the Atlantic. But in one important area of British life we must resist this trend: the incarceration rates for ethnic minorities.

item.title: Do hangovers really get worse as you get older?
item.description:
Do hangovers really get worse as you get older?

You drink, you drink, you drink and then somehow, you get up, shake it off, and get on with your life. Remember when drinking was like that, when you were young and invincible and you hadn't really thought through the meaning of student debt? That was nice wasn't it?

item.title: A Drug Trafficking Gang That Posed as a Flower Business Just Got 125 Years in Prison | VICE | United Kingdom
item.description:
A Drug Trafficking Gang That Posed as a Flower Business Just Got 125 Years in Prison | VICE | United Kingdom

The gang, from Holland and the northwest of the UK, were importing guns, weed, coke, MDMA and heroin.
